Honors & Awards

2022 Southern Conference Academic Honor Roll

2021 — Saw duty in 10 games as a reserve wide receiver, catching two passes for six yards...receptions came against N.C. State and Western Carolina...made the late season switch to tight end...named to the SoCon Academic Honor Roll for the 2021-22 school year.

2020 — Transferred in to Furman following a year at Charlotte...earned playing time in all seven games (spring of '21) and registered starts at flanker in the final two contests after injury sidelined Zach Peterson...tallied seven receptions for 62 yards...caught three passes for 30 yards versus Mercer, including a season long 16-yard grab...had two receptions for 27 yards against Chattanooga in his first career start.

2019 — As a true freshman at Charlotte appeared in all 12 games and caught eight passes for 65 yards...caught five passes for 49 yards in season opening win over Gardner-Webb.

High School: 2019 graduate of Christ Presbyterian (Division II-2A) Academy where he was a teammate of Paladin linebacker Bryce McCormick and kicker Sebastian Stubblefield...fielded 25 Division I scholarship offers, including five from FBS programs...football coach was former Furman quarterback and Hall of Fame quarterback Ingle Martin...named 2018 Division II AA Middle Region Offensive Player of the Year and consensus all-state in balloting by coaches and sportswriters after helping lead CPA to a 14-0 and state championship..topped Battle Ground Academy, 41-21, in state title game...finished his senior campaign with 72 receptions for 1,215 yards and 11 touchdowns...Tennessee Mr. Football semifinalist...as a junior he hauled in 81 passes for 1,171 yards and 14 scores... scored over 30 TDs in his three-year career

Personal: Full name is Noah Scott Henderson...born April 4, 2000, in Nashville, Tennessee....son of Scott and Tracie Henderson...father played baseball at South Alabama...has a sister, Julia...accounting major.
